author: robocopsgonemad
content: Can anyone point me to the history of why we initially setup validators with BLS keys instead of EL keys?  I understand how the withdrawal creds upgrade process works, and why its necessary, am just curious as to why we didn't use type 0x01 from the start... Did we just not want to burden registrants with providing 2 keys?

author: potuz
content: I think originally we were planning on moving everything to BLS addresses so that we could do aggregation and have more resistance than the current 20 bytes.  I think this comes from this post of Justin Drake https://ethresear.ch/t/pragmatic-signature-aggregation-with-bls/2105. At least this is what Ben Edington claimed in his work which is my unique and only one reference for all history of eth2 https://eth2book.info/altair/part2/building_blocks/signatures

author: robocopsgonemad
content: of course, i should've thought to check bens book.... thx potuz
